title: Fairly heavy showers expected in parts of the island
byline: The Meteorology Department says showers or thundershowers will occur at times in North-central, Eastern, Uva and Central provinces and in Hambantota district.

title: Sri Lanka signs the agreement for Hajj 2025
byline: Sri Lanka has signed the agreement for the Hajj pilgrimage – 2025, recently in Jeddah, Saudi Arabia.

title: Biden says Gaza deal based on his framework while Trump claims credit
byline: U.S. President Joe Biden and President-elect Donald Trump both claimed credit on Wednesday for a Gaza ceasefire-for-hostages deal that was months in the making but was helped across the line by a Trump envoy.

title: President Xi Jinping hails ‘historical opportunity’ for China-Sri Lanka ties
byline: Chinese leader Xi Jinping said relations between China and Sri Lanka faced a “historical opportunity” to foster ties, in talks with the island nation’s President Anura Kumara Dissanayake on Wednesday.

title: Over 25 ships turned back due to delays in container clearance – Dy. Minister
byline: Deputy Minister of Ports and Civil Aviation, Janith Ruwan Kodithuwakku, has stated that around 25 to 30 cargo ships that arrived in Sri Lanka have reportedly turned back due to delays in container clearance.

title: Rear Adm. Damian Fernando appointed Chief of Staff of SL Navy
byline: The President and Commander–in–Chief of the Armed Forces, Anura Kumara Dissanayake has appointed Rear Admiral Damian Fernando as the Chief of Staff of the Sri Lanka Navy.

title: Israel, Hamas reach ceasefire deal designed to end 15-month Gaza war
byline: Israel and Hamas agreed to a deal to halt fighting in Gaza and exchange Israeli hostages for Palestinian prisoners, an official briefed on the deal told Reuters on Wednesday, opening the way to a possible end to a 15-month war that has upended the Middle East.

title: TikTok prepares to shut down app in US on Sunday, sources say
byline: TikTok plans to shut U.S. operations of its social media app used by 170 million Americans on Sunday, when a federal ban is set to take effect, barring a last-minute reprieve, people familiar with the matter said on Wednesday.

title: Advisory issued for strong winds and rough seas
byline: The Department of Meteorology has issued an ‘Amber’ advisory for the sea areas off extending from Colombo to Kankasanthurai via Puttalam and Mannar and from Matara to Pottuvil via Hambantota.

title: Indian actor Saif Ali Khan attacked by intruder at Mumbai home, hospitalized
byline: Bollywood actor Saif Ali Khan has reportedly been attacked at his Mumbai home, and is currently admitted to the Lilavati Hospital.

title: India to provide grant for supplying police vehicles to Sri Lanka
byline: India would supply vehicles to be used by the Sri Lankan police under a grant, the Indian High Commission in Colombo said on Wednesday.

title: Two killed, 2 injured in shooting near Mannar Court
byline: Two individuals were killed while two other persons have been injured in a shooting incident in front of the Mannar Court this morning (16).

title: President commences third day of China visit; set to meet PM Li Qiang
byline: On the invitation of Chinese President Xi Jinping, Sri Lankan President Anura Kumara Dissanayake continues his four-day state visit to China, beginning the third day (16) by participating in an investment session scheduled for this morning.

title: President attends investment session with leading Chinese companies
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake is currently participating in the “Invest in Sri Lanka - Round Table Meeting 2025” with several leading Chinese companies. MORE.

title: PUCSL to conclude review of public opinions on electricity tariff revision today
byline: The Public Utilities Commission of Sri Lanka (PUCSL) says that the review of public opinions gathered on the proposed electricity tariff revision will be concluded today (17).

title: Sri Lanka, Sinopec sign agreement for USD 3.7 bln investment in oil refinery
byline: Sri Lanka’s Ministry of Power and Energy and China’s Sinopec Corporation have signed an agreement to build an oil refinery in Hambantota with an investment of USD 3.7 billion.

title: Bollywood star Saif Ali Khan out of danger after stabbing at Mumbai home
byline: Bollywood star Saif Ali Khan was out of danger, police said on Thursday, following stab injuries received in a scuffle with an intruder at his home in India’s financial capital of Mumbai for which he was undergoing surgery.

title: Appeals Court defers petition against Adani wind power project
byline: The Court of Appeal has moved the Fundamental Rights (FR) petitions filed seeking an order to invalidate the agreement reached by the Government of Sri Lanka with India’s Adani Green Energy for a wind power project in Wedithalathivu, Mannar to May 23, 2025.

title: President Dissanayake holds talks with Chinese Premier
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake has met with the Chinese Prime Minister Li Qiang and engaged in bilateral discussions, the President’s Media Division (PMD) said.

title: President assures Sri Lankan govt’s commitment to provide all necessary support for Chinese investors
byline: During his four-day state visit to China, President Anura Kumara Dissanayake held a series of strategic discussions with several globally acclaimed leading Chinese corporations following his participation in an investment forum organized by both public and private sector entities in China.

title: Underworld figure ‘Podi Lassie’ arrested in India
byline: Sri Lankan underworld figure and drug kingpin Janith Madushanka, also known as “Podi Lassie”, who fled the country after being granted bail, has been arrested in Mumbai, India.

title: Flood warning issued for Malwathu Oya basin further extended
byline: The flood warning issued for low-lying areas of the Malwathu Oya valley has been extended for 24 hours until 1.00 p.m. on Friday (17), the Department of Irrigation announced.

title: Shooting incident reported in Kohuwala
byline: A shooting incident has taken place near a school in the Kalubowila area of Kohuwala police division, the police said.

title: India achieves first space docking, becoming fourth country to achieve major milestone
byline: India on Thursday became the fourth country to successfully achieve an unmanned docking in space, a feat seen as pivotal for future missions as New Delhi cements its place as a global space power.

title: Netanyahu delays Israeli cabinet meeting to approve ceasefire deal
byline: Benjamin Netanyahu has said that the Israeli cabinet won’t meet to approve the ceasefire deal until Hamas backs down on “last minute concessions”.
